title: Great Britain's James Graham poised for milestone appearance in first match of Lions' tour
text:
Australian duo Lachlan Coote and Jackson Hastings are set to start for Great Britain against a Tonga Invitational XIII in Saturday's Test opener that will see captain James Graham win his 50th international cap.

The Great Britain side has been revived after a 12-year absence and this weekend's clash in Hamilton is followed by two matches against New Zealand in Auckland and Christchurch, ending on November 16 in Port Moresby with a first Test in Papua New Guinea since 1996.

Eyebrows were raised by Wayne Bennett's inclusion of St Helens full-back Coote, Salford scrum-half Hastings and compatriot Blake Austin, the Warrington stand-off, in his 24-man squad for the tour.

Revered Australian coach Bennett has named an initial team listing for this weekend's opener which also includes reformed character Zak Hardaker in the centres alongside Wigan club-mate Oliver Gildart.

St George Illawarra Dragons stand-off Gareth Widdop, who will make a big-money move to Warrington next season, will partner Hastings at half-back with Jermaine McGillvary and Ryan Hall on the wings. Chris Hill and Luke Thompson are named as the starting props with Josh Hodgson at hooker.
